üí™We have teams ready to respond.

@renton_phil @ben_watt @NaturalEngland @Brent_Council @EnvAgency @ChrisGPackham @WildLondon @Thames21 @CanalRiverTrust @renton_phil Hi Phil, thank you for taking the time to contact us. urls.title: How to prepare for flooding
urls.description: Find out what you can do to prepare¬†for a flood.

tweets.text: With Storm Christoph likely to cause heavy rainfall early tomorrow, we may see some flood alerts in place across Leeds. Here‚Äôs a useful guide from @EnvAgencyYNE showing what each flood alert means. More info at https://t.co/qxopW25Dr5 #PrepareActSurvive #Leeds https://t.co/6bd9UoAGXC

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyYNE @CityofYork @EnvAgency Have the folk behind the barrier been warned. Tomorrow's weather looks troublesome.@CityofYork
@jenjen3186 @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyYNE I don't need alcohol to look up at the sky and see what's going on. : )

Trees, hedgerows, fencing and sediment traps have been introduced to farms in the Esk Catchment as part of the Water Environment Grant (WEG) Esk Restoration Project. 

We will continue to work with @northyorkmoors, to deliver the project in spring 2021. 

#northyorkshire https://t.co/JFPLxwjJwK

@Sherherbert @CLAtweets Hello Mark, no need to be @CLATweets members - we work in association with partners @NFUtweets @NFUnortheast @DefraGovUK @Ruralpay @ForestryComm @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency  @NE_Northumbria @NaturalEngland to put on this annual FREE event which is supported by @NorthumbrianH2O.

Our flood forecast shows the areas at risk of flooding over the next 5 days. Take action now - check your flood risk and sign up to our flood warning service for the latest info:  https://t.co/6jAgryn4Al #floodaware https://t.co/l5nqRpmidI

Here‚Äôs the big crane for the @EnvAgencyYNE work on the #Foss barrier. They will get underway putting a new one in once river levels have gone back down, which with #stormchristoph could be a while. @theyorkmix news #york #yorknews https://t.co/RRcZHeXykv

tweets.text: @RachSalv @GeorgeMonbiot I've been to some of the leaking coastal landfills with @DrKateSpencer that she's been investigating. This one at Tilbury continues to leach out old rubbish, inc old car batteries. But no-one is taking responsibility for it - not the local council, nor the @EnvAgency. https://t.co/yWOXa7xpJS

@EnvAgency are tracking significant rainfall nationally in the next 6-10 days. This will lead to floods. Please be ready for flooding. Sign up to flood warnings, move your insurance documents and memorabilia. Lift outside items now. Listen to local radio, act on flood warnings

Expecting a number of @EnvAgency alerts & warnings to be issued this week as heavy rain is forecasted from Tues; make sure you're familiar with what these mean. Sign up for warnings at https://t.co/tX4sNhlku3

urls.title: Successful first year for waste crime taskforce despite pandemic
urls.description: The Joint Unit for Waste Crime celebrates its first anniversary of cracking down on criminals and gangs who commit serious and organised waste crime.

tweets.text:
#WasteCrime harms our environment, community and economy.
 
We joined forces with partners to form the Joint Unit for Waste Crime, to share intelligence and work in innovative ways to disrupt waste criminals. 
 
Here's what we've achieved after 1 year üëá
https://t.co/sYwoOeE6Xu https://t.co/dKen8cb5Py

If your home could be at risk of flooding please download our flooding advice leaflet to get the electricity related information you need before, during and after a flood. 

https://t.co/uVEtWZkHrU

#floodadvice #flooding #flood #teampowergrid @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency https://t.co/GiATQdyPXF

Devastating report confirms the dreadful state of the Cam and its chalk stream tributaries but water companies and @EnvAgency escape blame. (Not surprisingly given Cambridge Water co-commissioned it) @CamLabEF   @greenarteries  @CPRECambs @Feargal_Sharkey  https://t.co/tbBkUTPpnN

We are preparing our water rescue equipment today. You should be preparing your flood plans. Keep up to date with current advice from the @EnvAgencyYNE and @metoffice Another thing just to say, Don‚Äôt drive through floodwater. @NorthYorksFire https://t.co/k52H5JKxE5

The Joint Unit for Waste Crime is a year old. What has it achieved?

The JUWC joined other agencies on a raid in Kent. Seven people held on suspicion of various offences. 

Police found stolen vehicles, a loaded shotgun and other weapons. MORE: https://t.co/U7sHyVCF47

WATCH ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/zK60aGZRwv
